90022710ab6e5490e4b1e563f163bc5edc9b9735.body:
This reverts commit 3fea85a6f0c7beb18841b68e5bed5c8ff01a8a51.

The commit is good but to use `@available(macOS 10.14, *)` with osxcross one
needs to build `compiler-rt`, which can be done but might surprise some users
who have their custom build pipelines for 3.3.x (including the official build
system).

74cf62bb68afff6374f6ce4b1a7f5a198ed129d3.summary: HTML5: Fix minification error with Emscripten 1.39.9
74cf62bb68afff6374f6ce4b1a7f5a198ed129d3.body:
It used an old vendored version of acorn.js which seems to choke on this
trailing comma. This is not a problem for more recent Emscripten versions.

We disable the `comma-dangle` check in ESLint to prevent this issue.

(cherry picked from commit 23b51a1708e257b5962c0179a818513221ad98b6)

23b51a1708e257b5962c0179a818513221ad98b6.summary: HTML5: Fix minification error with Emscripten 1.39.9
23b51a1708e257b5962c0179a818513221ad98b6.body:
It used an old vendored version of acorn.js which seems to choke on this
trailing comma. This is not a problem for more recent Emscripten versions.

We disable the `comma-dangle` check in ESLint to prevent this issue.

41b1f2a7f91cfbdb02c7176cb176fea2f4af12b0.summary: [HTML5] Use browser mix rate by default on the Web.
41b1f2a7f91cfbdb02c7176cb176fea2f4af12b0.body:
Browsers doesn't really like forcing the mix rate, e.g. Firefox does not
allow input (microphone) if the mix rate is not the default one, Chrom*
will exhibit worse performances, etc.

(cherry picked from commit b800438efbc7ebd99c16ad315225a1ba24a6b4ee)

c939ef15fa295ea2d6952af75f47088c928824e7.body:
This pull request adds a small amendment to `SceneTree` describing the behavior `_physics_process()` when pausing the scene.

`_physics_process` will completely stop processing collisions and signals whenever the scene is paused, however, the function will still receive calls.

This addresses: #47326

(cherry picked from commit d62175e0099aee42d671b7629c0ad294d7b9e812)

a2f3decb8852d079d575dc017a79c7f5fbc0a5d5.summary: Prevent shaders from generating code before the constructor finishes.
a2f3decb8852d079d575dc017a79c7f5fbc0a5d5.body:
Fixes #43733: "creating SpatialMaterial in a separate thread creates invalid
shaders (temporarily)."

The bug occurred because various setters called in materials' constructors add
materials to queues that are processed on the main thread. This means that
when the materials are created in another thread, they can be processed on the
main thread before the constructor has finished.

The fix adds a flag to affected materials that prevents them from being added
to the queue until their constructors have finished initialising all the
members.

(cherry picked from commit 9e9bac1549cb293850feac145622267153f9c7aa)

9e9bac1549cb293850feac145622267153f9c7aa.summary: Prevent shaders from generating code before the constructor finishes.
9e9bac1549cb293850feac145622267153f9c7aa.body:
Fixes #43733: "creating SpatialMaterial in a separate thread creates invalid
shaders (temporarily)."

The bug occurred because various setters called in materials' constructors add
materials to queues that are processed on the main thread. This means that
when the materials are created in another thread, they can be processed on the
main thread before the constructor has finished.

The fix adds a flag to affected materials that prevents them from being added
to the queue until their constructors have finished initialising all the
members.
